definition: one's own mouth/fig. in one's own words/to say sth personally
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: She stays and waits for Ross to return so she can tell him.
sentences.chinese: 她留下來等待羅斯返家，並打算親口轉告他。

sentences.english: It's not the end of the world . Not until I say so , anyway.
sentences.chinese: 世界末日還沒到，除非是由我親口說的纔算。

sentences.english: We have heard it from his own lips.
sentences.chinese: 他親口所說的，我們都親自聽見了。

sentences.english: "If you had spoken when you ought to have spoken" I would have agreed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你從前好好的親口說破，我會同意的。

sentences.english: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves also will, by word of mouth, tell you the same things.
sentences.chinese: 我們派猶達和息拉去，他們要親口報告同樣的事。

sentences.english: If you promise that you love me .
sentences.chinese: 給我你的愛，承以你親口允諾。

sentences.english: The two found it easier to express feelings in emails than in person.
sentences.chinese: 她們倆發現在電子郵件裏比親口說更能表達感受。

sentences.english: You have told me yourself that you were not greedy for the presidency.
sentences.chinese: 你曾經親口告訴我你並不貪婪總統的職位。

sentences.english: Tapes of the hearing showed she had verbally pleaded guilty.
sentences.chinese: 聆訊錄音顯示她親口認罪。

sentences.english: For the mouth of the Lord has spoken.
